metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3488 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The libxslt support in contrib/xml2 in PostgreSQL 8.3 before 8.3.20, 8.4before 8.4.13, 9.0 before 9.0.9, and 9.1 before 9.1.5 does not properlyrestrict access to files and URLs, which allows remote authenticated usersto modify data, obtain sensitive information, or trigger outbound trafficto arbitrary external hosts by leveraging (1) stylesheet commands that arepermitted by the libxslt security options or (2) an xslt_process feature,related to an XML External Entity (aka XXE) issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3488` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.1.5-1
libecpg6 - 9.1.5-1
libpgtypes3 - 9.1.5-1
libpq5 - 9.1.5-1
postgresql-9.1 - 9.1.5-1
postgresql-client-9.1 - 9.1.5-1
postgresql-contrib-9.1 - 9.1.5-1
postgresql-plperl-9.1 - 9.1.5-1
postgresql-plpython-9.1 - 9.1.5-1
postgresql-plpython3-9.1 - 9.1.5-1
postgresql-pltcl-9.1 - 9.1.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.5-1').
